00028 /// Segment query info struct.
00029 typedef struct cpSegmentQueryInfo {
00030         /// The shape that was hit, NULL if no collision occured.
00031         cpShape *shape;
00032         /// The normalized distance along the query segment in the range [0, 1].
00033         cpFloat t;
00034         /// The normal of the surface hit.
00035         cpVect n;

00061 /// Opaque collision shape struct.
00062 struct cpShape {
00063         CP_PRIVATE(const cpShapeClass *klass);
00064         
00065         /// The rigid body this collision shape is attached to.
00066         cpBody *body;
00067 
00068         /// The current bounding box of the shape.
00069         cpBB bb;
00070         
00071         /// Sensor flag.
00072         /// Sensor shapes call collision callbacks but don't produce collisions.
00073         cpBool sensor;
00074         
00075         /// Coefficient of restitution. (elasticity)
00076         cpFloat e;
00077         /// Coefficient of friction.
00078         cpFloat u;
00079         /// Surface velocity used when solving for friction.
00080         cpVect surface_v;
00081 
00082         /// User definable data pointer.
00083         /// Generally this points to your the game object class so you can access it
00084         /// when given a cpShape reference in a callback.
00085         cpDataPointer data;
00086         
00087         /// Collision type of this shape used when picking collision handlers.
00088         cpCollisionType collision_type;
00089         /// Group of this shape. Shapes in the same group don't collide.
00090         cpGroup group;
00091         // Layer bitmask for this shape. Shapes only collide if the bitwise and of their layers is non-zero.
00092         cpLayers layers;
00093         
00094         CP_PRIVATE(cpSpace *space);
00095         
00096         CP_PRIVATE(cpShape *next);
00097         CP_PRIVATE(cpShape *prev);
00098         
00099         CP_PRIVATE(cpHashValue hashid);
00100 };

00141 /// When initializing a shape, it's hash value comes from a counter.
00142 /// Because the hash value may affect iteration order, you can reset the shape ID counter
00143 /// when recreating a space. This will make the simulation be deterministic.

00149 /// Get the hit point for a segment query.
00150 static inline cpVect cpSegmentQueryHitPoint(const cpVect start, const cpVect end, const cpSegmentQueryInfo info)
00151 {
00152         return cpvlerp(start, end, info.t);
00153 }
00154 
00155 /// Get the hit distance for a segment query.
00156 static inline cpFloat cpSegmentQueryHitDist(const cpVect start, const cpVect end, const cpSegmentQueryInfo info)
00157 {
00158         return cpvdist(start, end)*info.t;
00159 }
